intro: Polystemon pentaphyllus, commonly known as the five-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its ornamental value. Polystemon pentaphyllus is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty and ability to attract pollinators.
